bdy.p:
Recall Corporation is one of the world’s largest information management companies, helping approximately 80,000 customers store, protect and destroy important documents and data. Established in 1977, Recall is a subsidiary of
Brambles Limited an Australian industrial conglomerate. Recall headquarter is located in
Norcross (Atlanta), Georgia . Recall has three lines of business namely Document Management Solutions Physical (DMS-P) and Document Management Solutions Digital (DMS-D) , Secure Destruction Services (SDS) , Data Protection Services(DPS). Recall’s services include physical and electronic document storage and retrieval, protection of computer backup data, and destruction of sensitive documents. Recall leverages advanced technology to deliver customized Integrated Solutions for businesses who understand the value of bridging paper and digital information management. The company sees its wide geographic distribution of operations as its competitive strength. Recall operates about 300 facilities in 22 countries.

sec.p: In 1999, Brambles brought together a worldwide network of document management companies under the Recall name. Originally founded in 1875, Brambles is a multibillion-dollar global support services company–

In 2005, Recall decided to acquire its biggest competitor, the second largest documents and records management company Ausdoc in Australia. Recall leads Australia’s largest records and document management business.

Recall Corporation launched the industry's first full-cycle storage and management service and facility to utilize RFID technology for identification, inventory, and tracking of customers' document and electronic data archives.

Recall deployed RFID tagging at its Document Management Solutions Mega-Center in Northborough, Mass. Recall ensures its customers with a new layer of security and management efficiency thorough RFID technology. Also, RFID tagging supports strict compliance with data management regulations such as the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX), the
Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLBA)
, the Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act (FACTA) and more.
